page.title: 11Lychett Minster Church
page.content: This Parish Church looks old from the outside and we were surprised to see how modern it was inside. We met the Reverend E. Cardale who told us about the church.The church caters for eight thousand people but the parish of Lychett Minster also covers the Upton area. Upton has got its own church but it is not used as much as Lychett Minster church. The tower is the oldest remaining part of the original church. The tower and font are both about six hundred years old. In 1833 the church was rebuilt at the front. The Lees family used to own the big manor house which is now the main secondary school for the Lychett Minster, Upton and Lychett Matravers area. The Lees family had the stained glass windows for the church made for members of their family who had died.
